title_sort: charles eldridge to walt whitman, 15 october 1873
title: Charles Eldridge to Walt Whitman, 15 October 1873
text: WashingtonOct 15, 1873Dear Walt:Your letter came to hand yesterday with the key of the trunk enclosed. In accordance with your request I met Peter Doyle at Milburn's after office and we proceeded to your room and made up the package as you directed, and Peter took it to the Adams Express office.The contents are, Gray suit, coat, vest & one pair of pants. Black overcoat. Black felt hat. Pair of Buckskin gloves.You should receive them in good order to-day, as they were strongly enveloped & plainly directed.Let me know if you get them all right. I return the key enclosed herewith. Let me know how you are as often as you can. You had but one pair of gray pants, at least that was all there was in that trunk.Affectionately Yours,Charley Charles Eldridge to Walt Whitman, 15 October 1873
